user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_dauth_algo:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3
get_rq_dauth_algo (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const algo_param)
{
  if (NULL == algo_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5; /* Assume MD5 by default */

  if (algo_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_MD5_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA256_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_MD5_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN \
                                               _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))

      /* Algorithms below are not supported by MHD for authentication */

      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5_SESSION;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA256_TOKEN \
                                               _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256_SESSION;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256_SESSION;

    /* No known algorithm has been detected */
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_INVALID;
  }
  /* The algorithm value is not quoted */
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_MD5_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA256_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256;

  /* Algorithms below are not supported by MHD for authentication */

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_MD5_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5_SESSION;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA256_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256_SESSION;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256_SESSION;

  /* No known algorithm has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function get_rq_dauth_algo:
struct MHD_RqDAuthParam
{
  /**
   * The string with length, NOT zero-terminated
   */
  struct _MHD_str_w_len value;
  /**
   * True if string must be "unquoted" before processing.
   * This member is false if the string is used in DQUOTE marks, but no
   * backslash-escape is used in the string.
   */
  bool quoted;
}
...
#define MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n(q, l, u) MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n(q,l,u,MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(u))
...
#define MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_(a, s, l) ((MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(a)==(l))&&MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_(a,s,l))
...
#define _MHD_SESS_TOKEN "-sess"
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13 concerns pointers that should be to const-qualified types when possible. In this function all uses of algo_param->value.str are read-only (comparisons), so the underlying string pointer member should be examined for const-qualification. I therefore flagged: the NULL check and every call site that passes algo_param->value.str to string-comparison macros (both the quoted and non-quoted branches). I also flagged the struct MHD_RqDAuthParam definition which contains value (struct _MHD_str_w_len) because the actual member that holds the string (value.str) is not shown as const in the provided struct fragment and should be reviewed. Other parts of the code were not flagged because they do not involve pointers that are used read-only (e.g., enum returns, token macros that expand to string literals which are inherently const, or return statements). The macro definitions themselves were not flagged because their signatures in the provided snippets do not show pointer type declarations to be const-qualified; the primary concern is the concrete member value.str and its usage sites, which are all included above for investigation.
